data.title: Warriors of Kudlak (novelisation)
data.meta_description: Warriors of Kudlak was a novelisation based on the 2007 television story Warriors of Kudlak. data.text:
Warriors of Kudlak was a novelisation based on the 2007 television story Warriors of Kudlak. It was published simultaneously with the novelisations of Invasion of the Bane, Revenge of the Slitheen, and Eye of the Gorgon, and was thus tied with those three books as the first novelisation of a Doctor Who-related television production since the 1996 release of The Novel of the Film.

Publisher's summary[]

Life on Earth can be an adventure, too. You just need to know where to look.

When Luke and Clyde go missing after a trip to a laser-tag arena, Sarah Jane and Maria go to talk to Mark Grantham, the shifty owner. After some investigation, they realise he is working with Kudlak, an alien warrior, to recruit soldiers to fight a war on the planet Uvodni! Will Sarah Jane and Maria be able to stop him?

Chapter titles[]

Game on

Missing

Soldier boy

The arcade

Aliens

Project: Rain

Combat 3000

Piece of cake

Spaceships & ray guns

Into darkness

The crates

Back into space

Warriors of the future

Reunited

Characters[]

Sarah Jane Smith

Luke Smith

Maria Jackson

Alan Jackson

Clyde Langer

Mark Grantham

Uvlavad Kudlak

Pam

Louise Barsthorpe

Worldbuilding[]

Kelsey Hooper is still one of Maria's friends.

A top footballer from Deffry Vale High School took part at Combat 3000.

Haven Green is a huge stretch of parkland in Ealing.

Simon, Curtis, Ella and Jack were on the Uvodni warship.

Simon Metcalf was killed in the Iraq War just before Christmas 2007.

Taunton and Cleethorpes are located in England.

Notes[]

This is the last novelisation to not include the Doctor Who logo.

Lance Metcalf's father gets a name: Simon Metcalf.

Deviations from the televised story[]

The book begins with Lance Metcalf meeting Mark Grantham.

An addition scene featuring Alan Jackson is included in the book.

Continuity[]
